top_categories.workout_context: Rose City Rampage Gravel Race rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Rose City Rampage Gravel Race’s georgia plains, southern gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Rose City Rampage Gravel Race isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rose City Rampage Gravel Race. Make this intensity feel like home.
Rose City Rampage Gravel Race’s georgia plains gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Rose City Rampage Gravel Race when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Rose City Rampage Gravel Race’s georgia plains gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Rose City Rampage Gravel Race — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Rose City Rampage Gravel Race — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Every session at Rose City Rampage Gravel Race intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Rose City Rampage Gravel Race — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on georgia plains gravel.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Rose City Rampage Gravel Race count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Rose City Rampage Gravel Race’s 55 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Rose City Rampage Gravel Race requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on georgia plains gravel to build confidence. Expect: georgia plains, southern gravel, southeast us.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 55 miles of georgia plains gravel in Thomasville, GA.
